Key Arguments: The legislation is compared to historical book burnings, suggesting it is tyrannical.
Censorship of differing opinions is seen as detrimental to societal advancement.
There is skepticism about the government's ability to accurately determine what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
Notable Quotes: There is very little difference from book burning to a government squashing online content that it determines as mis/disinformation.
Advancement comes from healthy debate not a single viewpoint.
The worrying thing is who or what decides what is factual or fiction.
